subject: Communication
title: Glossophobia: Why We Fear the Stage
description: A fast breakdown of Glossophobia: Why We Fear the Stage for builders.

hook.text: Surveys consistently rank public speaking as a greater fear than death for many people.

buildup.text: Glossophobia â€” fear of public speaking â€” affects up to 75% of the population to some degree.

discovery.text: Your brain treats a watching audience like a physical threat. It triggers the same alarm system.

twist.text: The fear isn't about speaking. It's about being judged. Social rejection once meant exile or death.

climax.text: Evolution wired us to fear group disapproval. The stage just amplifies an ancient survival instinct.

punchline.text: Stage fright isn't weakness. It's your brain protecting you.
